org.jboss.gravia.runtime

Class ServiceException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • java.lang.RuntimeException
          • org.jboss.gravia.runtime.ServiceException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class ServiceException
extends RuntimeException
    A service exception used to indicate that a service problem occurred.

    A ServiceException object is created by the Runtime to denote an exception condition in the service. A type code is used to identify the exception type for future extendability.

    Since:
    27-Sep-2013
    Author:
    thomas.diesler@jboss.com
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      static int FACTORY_ERROR
      The service factory produced an invalid service object.
      static int FACTORY_EXCEPTION
      The service factory threw an exception.
      static int FACTORY_RECURSION
      The service factory resulted in a recursive call to itself for the requesting module.
      static int REMOTE
      An error occurred invoking a remote service.
      static int SUBCLASSED
      The exception is a subclass of ServiceException.
      static int UNREGISTERED
      The service has been unregistered.
      static int UNSPECIFIED
      No exception type is unspecified.
